newsitem.title: USA: Viacom's Blockbuster moving HQ to Dallas.
newsitem.headline: Viacom's Blockbuster moving HQ to Dallas.

text.p: Blockbuster Entertainment Group, a unit of Viacom Inc, said Friday it was moving its headquarters to Dallas from Fort Lauderdale.
It said the move would take place next spring.
All 1,000 associates at the Fort Lauderdale headquarters will be offered jobs at the new location, as well as relocation support, it said.
Outplacement services and severance will be given to associates who elect not to move to Dallas, and all associates will have access to "stress and change management workshops" during the transition.
Blockbuster currently employs nearly 1,200 people in the Dallas/Fort Worth area in retail stores and distribution centers.
"It makes good business sense to have all of our headquarters operations in the same city," Blockbuster Chairman and Chief Executive Bill Fields said in a statement.
